body_html:
I have the same issue.
The projects _periodic_resample_op, _nearest_neighbor.ops, _beam_search_ops, _gru_ops, and _lstm_ops give the error message:
LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file '\pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib'

Note that pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib exists (under tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\Release), and a rebuild of that project did not solve the problem.
I've also had some other errors on the first attempts, but those went away with a few recompiles.

Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): No
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Windows 7 Pro 64 bit
TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): Source
TensorFlow version (use command below): ?? version from GutHub 13th of March, 2018
Python version: 3.5
Bazel version (if compiling from source): N/A, using CMake
GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): Cmake 3.10.2, swigwin 3.0.12, Visual studio 2015
CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 9.0/cudnn-9.0-windows7-x64-v7.1
GPU model and memory: GTX 1080, 8 GB
Exact command to reproduce: switch to Release config, and press F7 (compile)

body:
I have the same issue.
The projects _periodic_resample_op, _nearest_neighbor.ops, _beam_search_ops, _gru_ops, and _lstm_ops give the error message: 
LINK : fatal error LNK1181: cannot open input file '\pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib'

Note that pywrap_tensorflow_internal.lib exists (under tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\Release), and a rebuild of that project did not solve the problem.
I've also had some other errors on the first attempts, but those went away with a few recompiles.

Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): No
OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): Windows 7 Pro 64 bit
TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): Source
TensorFlow version (use command below): ?? version from GutHub 13th of March, 2018
Python version: 3.5
Bazel version (if compiling from source): N/A, using CMake
GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): Cmake 3.10.2, swigwin 3.0.12, Visual studio 2015
CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 9.0/cudnn-9.0-windows7-x64-v7.1
GPU model and memory: GTX 1080, 8 GB
Exact command to reproduce: switch to Release config, and press F7 (compile)
